snippet: Attorney General Eric T. Schneiderman said in a lawsuit that the city diverted immigrants over 16 and unsteady in English into alternative programs in which they could not earn diplomas.
abstract: New York State Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman files suit against upstate Utica City School District alleging it engaged in discriminatory enrollment practices to bar immigrants and refugee children from enrolling in district's only public high school; suit grew out of statewide review of whether districts were adhering to Supreme Court mandate barring practice of asking children's immigration status before enrollment.
lead_paragraph: Attorney General Eric T. Schneiderman said in a lawsuit that the city diverted immigrants over 16 and unsteady in English into alternative programs in which they could not earn diplomas.

headline.main: New York State Accuses Utica School District of Bias Against Refugees
headline.print_headline: State Accuses Utica of Bias Against Refugee Students
